page.title: 03Limestone Dales: Derbyshire
page.content: We are fortunate to live within walking distance of two spectacular dales, Lathkill Dale in the north and Bradford Dale further south. Both are characteristic of Derbyshire dales with steep sided valleys at the base of which clear streams splash through successive rock beds and the remnants of man made dams. Once these valleys were the powerhouse of early industry; today nature has reclaimed all but a few crumbling buildings and spoil heaps. Earlier this year some young people tidied up Bradford Dale repairing walls, clearing dead trees and restoring the old sheep dip near Middleton. Both dales are now havens for many varieties of flora and fauna. Such is their beauty that both are attracting incraesing numbers of ramblers, nature lovers and tourists.
